intro: Doellingeria amygdalina, commonly known as the bittercup, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its yellow flowers and hairy, oval-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in sagebrush habitats. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Doellingeria amygdalina is adapted to arid environments and plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
